summary: Educational reform within the EU context refers to systematic changes aimed at enhancing the organisation of teaching and learning processes across member states. This concept encompasses various regulatory frameworks and initiatives designed to improve educational standards, accessibility, and inclusivity. The EU promotes educational reform through directives and funding programs that encourage innovative pedagogical methods and the integration of technology in education. By fostering collaboration among educational institutions and stakeholders, the EU seeks to ensure that educational systems are responsive to the evolving needs of society and the economy, ultimately contributing to the development of a skilled workforce and social cohesion.
